item.title: Minimum Wage Changes in Ontario
item.description: Ontario has recently made changes to the minimum wage and many didn’t react calmly. I thought it might be interesting to see what kinds of occupations will be affected by the changes. Thankfully, the federal government posted a dataset on wages that helps answer some questions. Exploring the data We can use the dataset to find out which occupations have a median wage of less than $14/hr. I’m particularly interested in my neck of the woods, Northern Ontario.

item.title: Using R with Google BigQuery
item.description: Google’s BigQuery has some interesting public datasets and luckily there’s an R package that makes interacting with the data extremely easy. The bigrquery library let’s you use SQL or dplyr statements to query the data which is super helpful. Simple Query I took a look at the data from the US Census Bureau’s International dataset which provides projections on population indicators. You need to create a projectid in the bigquery interface before you start.

item.title: Mapping 2016 Census Data
item.description: The 2016 Census has a lot of useful data to be examined. Luckily, there’s a great R package cancensus that let’s you access and map the data easily. You can use get_census to download the table and geographic features you need. sault_income <- get_census(dataset='CA16', regions=list(CMA="35590"), vectors="v_CA16_2397", level='DA', quiet = TRUE, geo_format = 'sf', labels = 'short') The dataframe is ready to be mapped using ggplot or leaflet if you want to be interactive.

item.title: Scraping Restaurant Health Inspections
item.description: Algoma Public Health is the public health agency in my area that inspects restaurants to ensure they are abiding by all the relevant food safety legislation. They are also nice enough to publish their restaurant health inspection reports online for anyone to review. I searched for a few restaurants that I frequent (phew Fratellis is safe!) but then I wanted to know which restaurants had the most health infractions?

item.title: Using rvest to scrape National Occupation Codes
item.description: At work, I’m always looking for a list of National Occupation Codes and their descriptions.
